tutorial.title: Wrapping Flex Items
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to wrap overflowing flex items inside a flex container.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn how to stop flex items from overflowing outside of their container.

Try out the Wrap button to see how elements stay inside their container when it gets smaller.

lessons.title: Flex wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
To stop elements from overflowing outside of the container, we use the flex-wrap property.

Make sure to pick flex-wrap.

lessons.title: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
The default value for flex-wrap is nowrap. That means if objects can't shrink anymore inside the container, they overflow outside of it.

Make sure to pick nowrap.

lessons.title: Wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use flex-wrap: wrap; to make items start on a new line when they don't fit anymore.

Make sure to pick wrap.

lessons.title: Wrap reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want items that don't fit to go to the top of the container instead of the bottom, we use wrap-reverse.

Make sure to pick wrap-reverse.

lessons.title: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
Like before, flex-wrap works for both columns and rows. Let's reverse the column direction.

Make sure to pick column, followed by wrap-reverse.

lessons.title: Try out
lessons.interactiveContent: Try out different flex-direction and flex-wrap settings to get a better idea of how everything works.

lessons.title: Question: Flex wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the flex-wrap property do?

It controls how flex items overflow when they don't fit inside a containerIt controls the size of flex items

It controls how flex items overflow when they don't fit inside a container.

lessons.title: Question: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the default flex-wrap value?

nowrapwrap

Make sure to pick nowrap.

lessons.title: Question: Wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does flex-wrap: wrap; do?

It makes flex items start on a new line when they don't fit in the containerIt splits flex items into equal rows

It makes flex items start on a new line when they don't fit in the container.

lessons.title: Question: Wrap reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does wrap-reverse do in case of a flex-direction: row.

It makes flex items overflow to the row aboveIt reverses the order of overflowing flex items

It makes flex items overflow to the row above.

lessons.title: Question: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

Two columns of flex itemsTwo rows of flex items

Two columns of flex items.

lessons.title: Example: Flex wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the flex-wrap property.

Make sure to pick flex-wrap.

lessons.title: Example: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the default value nowrap.

Make sure to pick nowrap.

lessons.title: Example: Wrap
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set flex-wrap to wrap.

Make sure to pick flex followed by - and then wrap, wrap.

lessons.title: Example: Wrap-reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make the flex items overflow to the row above, code wrap-reverse.

Make sure to pick wrap-reverse.

lessons.title: Example: Column
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set height to 200px and flex-direction to column.

Make sure to pick 200px, followed by column.

lessons.title: Example: Column Reverse
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set flex-wrap to wrap-reverse.

Make sure to pick wrap-reverse.
